conclusion: The task is to predict whether liquid from A, B, and C will flow into container D or E after passing through baffles.
The image shows three openings labeled A, B, and C at the top, with baffles of various colors and orientations below them, leading to two containers labeled D (red) and E (green) at the bottom.
Opening A is pink, opening B is light blue, and opening C is green.
The baffles are colored red, green, blue, orange, purple, and brown, and are positioned diagonally in various directions.
The containers at the bottom are shaped to funnel liquid, with D (red) located in the middle and E (green) on the left.
Liquid from opening A will hit the red baffle and be directed towards container D.
Liquid from opening B will hit the green baffle and be directed towards container E.
Liquid from opening C will hit the purple baffle and be directed towards container D.
The final prediction is that liquid from A and C will flow into container D, and liquid from B will flow into container E.
